result.execSummary:
The defendant Carlo J Goodger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
DNA Surcharge paid in full.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Court orders the firearm seized at time of arrest to be forfeited per Sec 961.555(2m), Wis. Stats. for City of Waukesha Police Department

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carlo J Goodger

records.addlTxt:
9:26 AM; Case called for Hearing. Defendant Carlo J Goodger in court.  Attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein in court for Carlo J Goodger.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Rothstein notes he has filed a plea questionnaire and is hoping to resolve the matter today.  Court confirms the plea questionnaire has been filed.  State recites the offer.  Atty. Rothstein confirms the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2, Court finds defendant guilty of Count 2.  Court orders Count 1 be dismissed and read in.

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Rothstein.
Defendant presents statements.

COUNT 2:
The Court Orders the Following:

Court orders the firearm seized at time of arrest to be forfeited per Sec 961.555(2m), Wis. Stats. for City of Waukesha Police Department.

FINE: $505.00;
	
DNA Surcharge: $200.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid within 60 days.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.
Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Comply with all licensing restrictions. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.

1:49 PM Defendant Carlo J Goodger in court.  Attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein in court for Carlo J Goodger. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 035726,
Payable Number: 474941,
Receipt Number: 22R 039002,
Amount: $20.00
10:55 AM Defendant Carlo J Goodger not in court.  District Attorney Law Intern in court for State of Wisconsin.  State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant.
Initial appearance on August 9, 2022 at 08:15 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
